Citation: Selhorst, A., & Lal, R. (2013). Net Carbon Sequestration Potential and Emissions in Home Lawn Turfgrasses of the United States. Environmental Management, 51(1), 198–208. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00267-012-9967-6
notes: Took the average value instead of the Minneapolis specific value as it was quite a bit higher than other cities which conflicts with one other study where Mpls had lowest seq rates

Citation: Nahlik, A. M., & Fennessy, M. S. (2016). Carbon storage in US wetlands. Nature Communications, 7(1), Article 1. https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13835
notes: This is for the E. Mts & Upper Midwest ecoregion. Might be substantial variation across this region given the broad category

Citation: Liu, S., Liu, J., Wu, Y., Young, C., Werner, J., Dahal, D., Oeding, J., & Schmidt, G. (2014). Baseline and Projected Future Carbon Storage, Carbon Sequestration, and Greenhouse-Gas Fluxes in Terrestrial Ecosystems of the Eastern United States.
notes: Estimates lower rates than other studies in general
